DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , non-randomized , observational , single center study subject surgically-correctable Stress Urinary Incontinence undergo suburethral sling operative procedure .
DOC.detailed_description: The study collect preoperative urologic testing , medical history , subject quality life patient questionnaire . Intraoperative procedural data collect . Postoperative complication , urologic , test , subject questionnaire collect interval . The anatomic position device characterize introital ultrasound testing .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient objective demonstrable sign stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) , include patient intrinsic sphincter deficiency ( ISD ) . Objective test include : standing stress test , urodynamics evaluation , pad test . 2 . Patient age 18 old . 3 . Patient agree participate study , include completion studyrelated procedure evaluation , document agreement sign IRB/ECapproved informed consent . 4 . Patient able fill questionnaire ( judgement investigator ) 1 . Patient associate suspected neurological disease . 2 . Patient active lesion present injury perineum urethra . 3 . Patient urethral obstruction . 4 . Patient significant pelvic organ prolapse ( Grade III/IV ) require surgical treatment . 5 . The subject current urinary tract infection .
